intro: Valerianella coronata var. discoidea, commonly known as the "buttercup sorrel," is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy and emit a mild, somewhat peppery scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in meadows and along streambanks. Valerianella coronata var. discoidea is often used in herbal remedies and is valued for its culinary and medicinal properties.
